p: In humans, virtually all Zn is present in intracellular compartments. Zn distribution in different organelles was estimated as follows: nucleus (30–40 %), cytosol and other organelles and specialized vesicles (50 %), and the rest is bound with cell membrane proteins ( Vallee and Falchuk, 1993). In humans, plasma Zn level ranges between 10–18 mol/L representing 0.1 % of total body Zn ( Foster and Samman, 2012). Earlier it was reported that the in vitro Zn requirement for typical fibroblast-like cells is about 0.25 fmol per cell or 200 μM in ordinary culture media. However, in vitro growth of the cells stops at cellular Zn levels below ∼0.2 fmol per cell ( Palmiter and Findley, 1995).
